is a twin city on the border between the
region of
and
in
. Echuca is the larger half of the town and is on the southern, Victorian, side of the Murray River, and Moama is the smaller and is on the New South Wales side.

Echuca-Moama is about 2 1/2 hours drive from Melbourne CBD. Trains and buses arrive at Echuca Railway Station about 5 times a weekday and about the same on weekends. Most services come from Bendigo Rail/Bus Staion, but they also come from Shepparton as well. Coaches only take 2 hour 45 minutes from Melbourne as opposed to the train which detours through Bendigo.
Unfortunately, apart from the occasional bus services, there are no other transportation around town. However, the town is relatively small and walking around is possible.
Paint ball, watersports, riverboat cruises, The Great Aussie Beer Shed, eco tours, The Holden Motors museum.
There is a blacksmith and a wood turner selling hand made items, both based near Oscar W's.
In addition to pub food, there are also a few restaurants:

value: Oscar W's - Echuca's only 1 hat restaurant (rated by The Age)
The Black Pudding - a delicatessen serving brunch, lunch and selling much Australian produce

There are a few pubs in the area

value: Shamrock Irish Pub - Irish pub also serving parmagiana and trivia nights (Thursday)

There is also 1 nightclub in the area
DJs and/or live bands frequent
on weekends until the early hours of the morning.
